xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: This present work was mainly supported by a grant from the European Commission for Research through the Marie Curie Initial Training Networks (FP7-PEOPLE-ITN-2008 Project no. 237962 ). The project is also supported by the Belgian IWT fund (Cyaggtech) and by the Icelandic Research Fund (RANNÍS). We would like to thank Vivek Gaware for supplying low molecular weight chitosan (10 kDa) for our research.

organization.$: Department of Organic Chemistry and Technology
Budapest University of Technology and Economics
Department of Pharmaceutics and Industrial Pharmacy

head.citation-title: Formation and stability assessment of self-assembled nanoparticles from large Mw chitosan and sulfobutylether-β-cyclodextrin
head.abstracts: © 2015 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.Stable self-assembled nanoparticles were prepared by mixing aqueous solutions containing chitosan and either sulfobutylether β-cyclodextrin or sulfobutylether γ-cyclodextrin at pH 4. The nanoparticle formation was monitored by UV-VIS spectroscopy operated at 700 nm. The stability of the nanoparticle system was tested under different conditions, for example upon storage, upon dilution, at elevated temperatures and upon salt addition. The effect of media pH on the formation and stability of the nanoparticles was also tested. Stability studies were followed by dynamic light scattering measurements and showed that the nanoparticles are stable at all conditions tested except in basic media. The nanoparticles were investigated by transmission electron microscopy which confirmed that the diameter of the nanoparticles is between 100 and 200 nm. Drug release from the particles was studied using hydrocortisone as a model drug.
